Title: March 30
DevoText: The psalmist was concerned that he not be forsaken until God declared His power to the next generation. Every generation must know firsthand the power of God. It is not enough to hear about it from the previous generation. We must experience it ourselves.

Title: March 31
DevoText: How important it is to have your own knowledge of the Word of God! What your parents or grandparents knew and taught you about the Word of God should not be your only source of revelation. Seek God for your own understanding and relationship with Him.

Title: April 1
DevoText: Moses spoke of a prophet who would be raised up from among his own brothers. He would be so powerful that His word would be final. Anyone who did not listen to Him would have to answer to God.

Title: April 2
DevoText: Jesus set for His disciples the example of a resolute life. He was determined to accomplish His purpose for coming to this earth. He tolerated no double-mindedness in His followers.

Title: April 3
DevoText: As used in this context, your neighbor means "someone near." God has positioned near us all kinds of people with all kinds of needs. By showing love and generosity to such people, we show love to God.

Title: April 4
DevoText: Love for a neighbor is always measured (as it was in the story of the Good Samaritan) in practical ways. Love for God, however, is often measured in impractical ways. In Martha's story, we see Jesus teaching that sometimes love for God means setting aside our duties to sit at His feet.
